questions.text: Which of the following is an ethical concern related to IIoT?
options: Increased efficiency
Job displacement due to automation
Better product quality
Reduced energy consumption

questions.text: The use of workplace monitoring sensors to track employee movement and productivity raises concerns about:
options: Data accuracy
Worker privacy
Network bandwidth
Sensor battery life

questions.text: If an autonomous factory robot causes an injury, determining who is liable (the owner, the manufacturer, the software developer) is a complex _________ question.
options: technical
legal and ethical
financial
marketing

questions.text: What is 'algorithmic bias' in the context of IIoT?
options: When an algorithm is too efficient
When an algorithm systematically produces unfair outcomes for certain groups
When an algorithm is written in a biased programming language
When an algorithm is free of errors
questions.correctAnswer: When an algorithm systematically produces unfair outcomes for certain groups

questions.text: An IIoT system that predicts which employees are likely to quit their jobs could be used unethically to:
options: Offer incentives to high-performing employees to stay
Proactively deny promotions or opportunities to those employees
Improve the work environment to increase retention
Conduct anonymous surveys about job satisfaction
questions.correctAnswer: Proactively deny promotions or opportunities to those employees

questions.text: The 'digital divide' in the context of Industry 4.0 refers to:
options: The gap between digital and analog signals
The gap between companies/countries that have access to and skills for new technologies and those that do not
The physical distance between a sensor and the cloud
A software bug
questions.correctAnswer: The gap between companies/countries that have access to and skills for new technologies and those that do not

questions.text: What is a key principle of 'responsible AI'?
options: Making AI as complex as possible
Ensuring AI systems are fair, transparent, and accountable
Keeping the workings of AI systems a complete secret
Focusing only on profitability
questions.correctAnswer: Ensuring AI systems are fair, transparent, and accountable

questions.text: The environmental impact of IIoT includes:
options: Only positive impacts, such as energy efficiency
Only negative impacts, such as e-waste
Both potential positive (e.g., resource optimization) and negative (e.g., energy consumption of data centers, e-waste) impacts
No environmental impact
questions.correctAnswer: Both potential positive (e.g., resource optimization) and negative (e.g., energy consumption of data centers, e-waste) impacts

questions.text: Why is the 'right to explanation' a significant topic for AI and IIoT?
options: It is not significant
It ensures that individuals can understand the basis for decisions made by automated systems
It requires all AI to be simple enough for a child to understand
It gives companies the right to explain their high profits
questions.correctAnswer: It ensures that individuals can understand the basis for decisions made by automated systems

questions.text: A potential societal impact of widespread IIoT adoption is:
options: A decrease in the need for education
A shift in the workforce skills required, demanding more data science and technical expertise
The elimination of all manual labor jobs overnight
A return to pre-industrial lifestyles
questions.correctAnswer: A shift in the workforce skills required, demanding more data science and technical expertise
